item.title: #TIL : Internal Variables in BASH
item.description: Internal Variables in BASH $PWD Your current working directory, so you don’t have to use CWD=$(pwd) $OLDPWD Your previous working directory Note : You can jump directly to it by the command cd - $SECONDS The number of seconds the script has been running You can use it for profiling or limiting timeout TIME_LIMIT=60 while [ "$SECONDS" -le "$TIME_LIMIT" ] do ## Your hard work here done echo "It takes $SECONDS seconds to get here !

item.title: #TIL : Simple HTTP server function helper
item.description: Simple HTTP server function helper I use python3 (3.4+) to create a bash function to help me start quickly a simple http server on specified port function server() { local port="${1:-8000}" # Getting port number google-chrome "http://127.0.0.1:$port" # Open URL in browser, could change to firefox --new-tab "http://127.0.0.1:$port" python3 -m http.server $port --bind 127.0.0.1 }
